sentence.Network_en: I have disgraced my family's name.
They have disgraced the whole school.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们给整个学校都丢了脸.

PerfectNetExp.abs: Federal authorities are seizing the Palm Beach mansion of disgraced financier Bernard Madoff ., 名誉扫地的金融巨骗伯纳德 ? 麦道夫的棕榈湾寓所日前被联邦当局查封.
BBC新闻讲解附字... ... 6.irregularities n. 谬误 7.disgraced adj. 羞辱的，指不再被认同和尊敬 9.exonerate vt. 开释,免除,解除.
Our disgraced teacher was publicly rehabilitated by school authorities ., 学校当局为我们的蒙受耻辱的老师公开恢复了名誉.
You know how I am scorned , disgraced and shamed ; all my enemies are before you ., 你知道我受的辱骂 , 欺凌 , 羞辱 ． 我的敌人都在你面前.

list.abs: Doctors like that are a disgrace to our hospitals ., 那样的医生是我们医院的一种耻辱.
not to disgrace your profession or anything . there's three weeks left in school , just give me af * * king break !不是想玷污你的职业，现在只有三个星期的时间我就毕业了，就不能让我屏蔽词语休息一下！
I would rather die than disgrace myself ., 我宁死不受辱.
体面的的英文... ... 体面的恶棍 ： an honorable villain 不体面的行为 ： disgraceful conduct 不体面的行为 ： shameful behavior.

entry.def: You use disgraced to describe someone whose bad behaviour has caused them to lose the approval and respect of the public or of people in authority.

auth_sentence.content: The reviews have not been charitable to the disgraced champion.
auth_sentence.res_content: The reviews have not been charitable to the disgraced champion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The reviews have not been charitable to the disgraced champion.

auth_sentence.content: Thomas Pearson was the disgraced paterfamilias of a middle class Glasgow family.
auth_sentence.res_content: Thomas Pearson was the disgraced paterfamilias of a middle class Glasgow family.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Thomas Pearson was the disgraced paterfamilias of a middle class Glasgow family.

auth_sentence.content: Said you have disgraced yourself, disgraced your family and disgraced Egypt.
auth_sentence.res_content: Said you have disgraced yourself, disgraced your family and disgraced Egypt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Said you have disgraced yourself, disgraced your family and disgraced Egypt.
